articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in C# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# The 9th Chord in C# (Shape: G)

The 9th chord in C# using the G shape is a unique and colorful chord that provides a jazzy and sophisticated sound to your music. This chord is built on the root note C# and includes the following notes:

- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)
- D# (Major 9th)

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: C#
- Major 3rd: E#
- Perfect 5th: G#
- Major 7th: B#
- Major 9th: D#

## Musical Flavor
The 9th chord in C# (G shape) is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and funk styles due to its rich and complex harmonies. It gives a smooth and sophisticated flavor to the music, adding warmth and depth to chord progressions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 9th chord in C# (G shape):
1. *"Isn't She Lovely"* by Stevie Wonder
2. *"It's Probably Me"* by Sting
3. *"Chameleon"* by Herbie Hancock
